destinations.name: Taudaha Lake
destinations.description: A tranquil freshwater lake on the southern outskirts of Kathmandu, known for its rich birdlife, especially migratory birds. It holds local legends and is a peaceful escape from the city.

destinations.name: Siddha Pokhari
destinations.description: A historic and large rectangular artificial lake located near the main gate of Bhaktapur Durbar Square. It's a popular spot for locals to relax and is particularly vibrant during festivals.

destinations.name: Kamal Pokhari
destinations.description: A historic pond in Kathmandu, known for its lotus blooms (Kamal means lotus) during season. It serves as a public space for recreation and relaxation, recently undergoing significant renovation.

destinations.name: Nag Pokhari (Naxal)
destinations.description: A historic pond in Naxal, Kathmandu, named after the mythical Nag (serpent) deities. It's a significant cultural site, especially during Nag Panchami festival.

destinations.name: Nagdaha (Lalitpur)
destinations.description: A large natural lake located in Dhapakhel, Lalitpur, believed to be the abode of the serpent king Nagraj. It's a vital wetland for various bird species and a popular local pilgrimage site.

destinations.name: Pimbahal Pond
destinations.description: A traditional square-shaped pond located in Patan, Lalitpur, surrounded by ancient temples and Newari architecture. It serves as a historical and community gathering point.

destinations.name: Ikha Pokhari
destinations.description: A historic pond located near the Itum Bahal courtyard in Kathmandu's old city. It's a smaller, traditional pond reflecting the historical water management systems of the valley.

destinations.name: Bhandarkhal Pond
destinations.description: A historic pond located within the royal palace complex of Patan Durbar Square, part of the traditional water features and gardens of the Malla era. It reflects the intricate water systems of ancient palaces.

destinations.name: Tusha Hiti
destinations.description: A magnificent sunken royal bath and stone spout (hiti) located within Sundari Chowk of Patan Durbar Square. Known for its intricate stone carvings and gilded metalwork, it's a prime example of Malla-era water architecture.

destinations.name: Naag Pokhari (Bhaktapur Durbar Square)
destinations.description: A historic pond located within the complex of Bhaktapur Durbar Square, known for its serpent imagery and cultural significance, particularly during local festivals.
